title: Recall Electron vs. Molecular Geometry
text: Remember: electron geometry considers all electron groups (including lone pairs), while molecular geometry considers only the positions of atoms.

title: Carbon Atom A
text: Look at Carbon A: it has four single bonds. What geometry does this correspond to?

title: Nitrogen Atom B
text: Nitrogen B has three bonding pairs and one lone pair. What is its electron geometry? What is its molecular shape?

title: Carbon Atom C
text: Carbon C is double-bonded to oxygen and has two single bonds. Count the electron groups and identify the geometries.
